title: Job Openings at Westfield Energy Resources Limited
content:
Westfield Energy Resources Limited is a leading integrated energy services and solutions provider operating across the entire upstream Oil & Gas, Power and Infrastructure value chain in West Africa. Our capabilities cover the Engineering, Procurement, Construction and Installation (EPCI), Commissioning, start-up services and Project Management.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales & Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Lead initiatives to achieve and exceed overall sales and business development objectives.
	Oversee marketing spend to ensure efficient allocation and maximum ROI.
	Supervise preparation and submission of proposals and bids to secure high-value contracts.
	Identify and develop key relationships with industry stakeholders, partners, and clients.
	Report performance insights and progress to the Head of Business services, highlighting opportunities and challenges.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Engineering, or related fields.
	7-10 years of experience in Sales, Business Development, or related roles within the oil & gas, EPCIC, or energy services sector.
	Proven track record of revenue growth and successful tendering in high-value projects.
	Strong negotiation, leadership, and management skills.
	Excellent understanding of the Nigerian oil & gas market, NIPEX tendering processes , and regulatory frameworks.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a cover letter to: jobs@westfieldenergy.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Senior Internal Control Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary


	The Internal Control Officer will be responsible for establishing and implementing a robust internal control framework across all departments of Westfield Energy Resources Limited.
	The role ensures compliance with company policies, financial integrity, risk mitigation, and performance governance.
	The position reports directly to the Managing Director and works closely with the Performance Governance & Risk/ISO Units.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop, review, and implement internal control policies and procedures.
	Conduct periodic audits, risk assessments, and compliance reviews across departments.
	Monitor adherence to financial, operational, and procurement processes.
	Identify control weaknesses, propose remedial actions, and track implementation.
	Support management in evaluating departmental KPIs and performance frameworks.
	Ensure compliance with ISO standards, HSE regulations, and statutory requirements.
	Investigate irregularities, fraud, and non-compliance cases.
	Prepare internal audit reports and present findings to management.
	Coordinate with Finance, Operations, and HR teams to strengthen control systems.
	Promote a culture of accountability, transparency, and ethical conduct.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related discipline.
	Minimum of 6–10 years of relevant experience in internal control, audit, or risk management (Oil & Gas industry experience preferred).
	Professional certifications such as ACA, ACCA, CIA, or CISA will be an advantage.
	Strong analytical, investigative, and reporting skills.
	In-depth knowledge of ERP systems, ISO standards, and Nigerian corporate regulations.
	Excellent communication, integrity, and attention to detail.


Compensation & Benefits


	Competitive salary based on experience and grade level.
	Career growth within a structured 12-grade organizational framework.
	13th-month bonus, and other company benefits.
	Performance-based incentives and professional development opportunities.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a cover letter to: jobs@westfieldenergy.com using “Senior Internal Control Officer” as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Technical Assistant to the Managing Director

Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary


	The Technical Assistant (TA) to the Managing Director will provide high-level strategic, analytical, and operational support to the Managing Director in driving corporate initiatives, business performance, and stakeholder engagements.
	The role requires a proactive, detail-oriented professional who can synthesize complex information, prepare executive briefs, track strategic projects, and coordinate interdepartmental performance reports.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide analytical, technical, and research support to the Managing Director on business strategy, operations, and performance matters.
	Track implementation of key strategic initiatives and performance scorecards across departments.
	Prepare executive reports, presentations, memos, and board documents for internal and external stakeholders.
	Coordinate and follow up on decisions made at management and executive meetings.
	Liaise with departmental heads to ensure timely submission of performance and project updates.
	Support the MD in monitoring sales, revenue, and operational KPIs.
	Assist in policy formulation, compliance tracking, and risk mitigation initiatives.
	Represent the Managing Director in internal meetings when required.
	Maintain confidentiality and demonstrate professionalism in all dealings.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Economics, or related field (MBA or Master’s degree is an added advantage).
	3–7 years of experience in technical, strategic, or performance management roles within the Oil & Gas, Energy, or Consulting sectors.
	Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and data analysis tools.
	Ability to multitask, meet deadlines, and maintain a high level of discretion.
	Excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills.


Remuneration & Benefits


	Competitive salary commensurate with grade level.
	13th-month bonus, and other company benefits.
	Performance-based bonuses and career advancement opportunities within Westfield’s 12-grade structure.
	Exposure to executive decision-making and strategic business operations.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a cover letter to: jobs@westfieldenergy.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Job Position: Service Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Description


	We are looking for an individual who would play a pivotal role in turning clients&#39; aspirations into reality, providing expert guidance and support throughout the after-sales process.
	By ensuring a smooth transition from sales to service, we empower our clients to achieve their goals and seamlessly integrate into their new life.
	Key responsibilities include client onboarding, documentation handling, application coordination, and fostering commitment to optimized payment plans.
	This role is vital to maintaining high client satisfaction, efficient processing, and the integrity of the product.
	By delivering exceptional service, the Service Manager helps build client trust, and long-term engagement, paving way for brand loyalty and future sales.


Key Responsibilities
Client Onboarding:


	iWelcome newly signed clients, introduce them to the process, and provide full orientation on what to expect, throwing light to the entire journey.
	Schedule appointments and initiate the application process.


Documentation Management:


	iGuide clients through the documentation requirements, ensure timely collection of all necessary documents, maintain accurate records and support with challenging steps.
	Work with cross-functional teams to verify data and resolve discrepancies.
	Follow up with clients regarding outstanding documents prioritizing clients&rsquo; comfort.


Application Processing:


	Liaise with legal and immigration partners to ensure efficient processing of client applications and submission of required documentation.
	Offer personalized end-to-end services, including medical and photography services, at clients&#39; convenience.
	Manage the scheduling of IELTS tutorials and exams for Canadian applicant clients.
	Provide ongoing support to clients throughout their incubation program, including meeting reminders and task management.


Data Management:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of client interactions, including meeting notes, communication, and progress updates.
	Ensure data integrity and confidentiality, adhering to organizational standards and regulatory requirements.
	Provide timely and relevant data insights to support internal stakeholders, facilitating informed decision-making and exceptional client service.


Payment Plan Optimization:


	Override standard payment plans (e.g., reduce a 6-month plan to 2 months) to encourage quicker processing and commitment to the program there by making timely payment.
	Monitor and manage client payment records to ensure compliance with agreed payment schedules and escalate delays or discrepancies as necessary.


Client Relationship Management:


	Serve as the primary point of contact post-sale, maintain proactive communication and resolve any client concerns or escalate promptly.
	Acknowledge client inquiries regarding the program and promptly refer them to the appropriate specialist for accurate and informed responses.


Internal Coordination:


	Work closely with operations teams to ensure alignment and smooth handover from sales to service.
	Coordinate with international partners and in-house processing teams to stay updated on client application progress.
	Escalate and follow up on any delays or issues in the processing timeline, ensuring prompt resolution.


Compliance &amp; Confidentiality:


	Ensure all client information is handled in accordance with legal and company confidentiality standards.
	Maintain a comprehensive client database.
	Adhere to national data protection regulations while managing client data.
	Carry out any other duties as assigned by the direct report or Chairman.


Education &amp; Experience


	A good First degree in any field; Master&#39;s degree is an advantage
	Minimum of 10 years of experience in Customer Service, Sales, Consulting, Public Relations, or related fields including 3+ years in senior leadership or management positions
	Prior experience in a high-touch, client-facing role within a structured, professional environment is strongly desirable
	Age Requirement: 35-47 years


Core Competencies:


	Client Relationship Management: Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport, manage expectations, and maintain long-term client engagement.
	Attention to Detail: Meticulous and methodical approach to document handling, record-keeping, and data verification.
	Process Management: Ability to manage end-to-end client service processes efficiently, including onboarding, follow-up, and application timelines.
	Coordination &amp; Multitasking: Proven ability to manage multiple clients and tasks simultaneously while maintaining accuracy and meeting deadlines.
	Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to handle sensitive conversations and escalate issues diplomatically.
	Discretion &amp; Confidentiality: Strong understanding of data protection, confidentiality, and client privacy protocols.
	Problem Solving: Resourceful and solution-oriented, capable of resolving service-related issues with minimal supervision.
	Technology Proficiency: Competent in the use of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook), CRM systems, and other digital tools used in documentation and client tracking.


Behavioral Attributes:


	High level of integrity and professionalism.
	Empathy and cultural sensitivity when dealing with clients from diverse backgrounds.
	Results-driven mindset with a commitment to quality service delivery.
	Proactive, organized, and dependable.


Bonus Qualifications (Preferred but not mandatory):


	Knowledge of immigration processes (especially Canada, EU, and Caribbean programs).
	Experience working with legal or documentation teams.
	Familiarity with IELTS exam logistics or international relocation services.


Method of Application
